TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit UploadProgressChangedEventArgs extends System.ComponentModel.ProgressChangedEventArgs

Docs.summary: Provides data for the event of a .

remarks.format: ## Remarks Instances of this class are passed to the <xref:System.Net.UploadProgressChangedEventHandler>.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property BytesReceived As Long
public: property long BytesReceived { long get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the number of bytes received.
Docs.value: An value that indicates the number of bytes received.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Uploading data to a server may result in a download from the server. For example, suppose your application uploads a POST request to a Web server. The resulting download will update <xref:System.Net.UploadProgressChangedEventArgs.BytesReceived%2A> and <xref:System.Net.UploadProgressChangedEventArgs.TotalBytesToReceive%2A>.
To determine what percentage of the transfer has occurred, use the <xref:System.ComponentModel.ProgressChangedEventArgs.ProgressPercentage%2A> property. When the upload is complete, <xref:System.ComponentModel.ProgressChangedEventArgs.ProgressPercentage%2A> will be 50%. When the download completes, <xref:System.ComponentModel.ProgressChangedEventArgs.ProgressPercentage%2A> will be 100%.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property BytesSent As Long
public: property long BytesSent { long get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the number of bytes sent.
Docs.value: An value that indicates the number of bytes sent.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Uploading data to a server may result in a download from the server. For example, suppose your application uploads a POST request to a Web server. The resulting download will update <xref:System.Net.UploadProgressChangedEventArgs.BytesReceived%2A> and <xref:System.Net.UploadProgressChangedEventArgs.TotalBytesToReceive%2A>.
To determine what percentage of the transfer has occurred, use the <xref:System.ComponentModel.ProgressChangedEventArgs.ProgressPercentage%2A> property. When the upload is complete, <xref:System.ComponentModel.ProgressChangedEventArgs.ProgressPercentage%2A> will be 50%. When the download completes, <xref:System.ComponentModel.ProgressChangedEventArgs.ProgressPercentage%2A> will be 100%.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property TotalBytesToReceive As Long
public: property long TotalBytesToReceive { long get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the total number of bytes in a data upload operation.
Docs.value: An value that indicates the number of bytes that will be received.

remarks.format:
## Remarks To determine the number of bytes already received, use the <xref:System.Net.DownloadProgressChangedEventArgs.BytesReceived%2A> property.
Uploading data to a server may result in a download from the server. For example, suppose your application uploads a POST request to a Web server. The resulting download will update <xref:System.Net.UploadProgressChangedEventArgs.BytesReceived%2A> and <xref:System.Net.UploadProgressChangedEventArgs.TotalBytesToReceive%2A>.
To determine what percentage of the transfer has occurred, use the <xref:System.ComponentModel.ProgressChangedEventArgs.ProgressPercentage%2A> property. When the upload is complete, <xref:System.ComponentModel.ProgressChangedEventArgs.ProgressPercentage%2A> will be 50%. When the download completes, <xref:System.ComponentModel.ProgressChangedEventArgs.ProgressPercentage%2A> will be 100%.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property TotalBytesToSend As Long
public: property long TotalBytesToSend { long get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the total number of bytes to send.
Docs.value: An value that indicates the number of bytes that will be sent.

remarks.format:
## Remarks To determine the number of bytes already sent, use the <xref:System.Net.UploadProgressChangedEventArgs.BytesSent%2A> property.
Uploading data to a server may result in a download from the server. For example, suppose your application uploads a POST request to a Web server. The resulting download will update <xref:System.Net.UploadProgressChangedEventArgs.BytesReceived%2A> and <xref:System.Net.UploadProgressChangedEventArgs.TotalBytesToReceive%2A>.
To determine what percentage of the transfer has occurred, use the <xref:System.ComponentModel.ProgressChangedEventArgs.ProgressPercentage%2A> property. When the upload is complete, <xref:System.ComponentModel.ProgressChangedEventArgs.ProgressPercentage%2A> will be 50%. When the download completes, <xref:System.ComponentModel.ProgressChangedEventArgs.ProgressPercentage%2A> will be 100%.
